I encounter the same issue with VS2008 Enterprise SP1 on Windows 7 Enterprise (full VS Configuration attached).

Same thing on visual studio 2010 beta 2, did a checkout of build 29533.

The first line of the following lines is the source of the error :

    <PixelShaderCompile Sources="@(Effect)">
      <Output TaskParameter="Outputs" ItemName="Resource" />
    </PixelShaderCompile>

Had this issue on a newly installed Windows 7 x64 Ultimate.
Installed the DirectX SDK (Feb 2010) and it went away.  Shaders compile now.

I'm getting the same thing with VS 2010 and Windows 7 x64 SP1.

Here's the complete error:

Error	2	The "PixelShaderCompile" task failed unexpectedly.
System.NullReferenceException: Object reference not set to an instance of an object.
   at ShaderBuildTask.PixelShaderCompile.Execute()
   at Microsoft.Build.BackEnd.TaskExecutionHost.Microsoft.Build.BackEnd.ITaskExecutionHost.Execute()
   at Microsoft.Build.BackEnd.TaskBuilder.ExecuteInstantiatedTask(ITaskExecutionHost taskExecutionHost, TaskLoggingContext taskLoggingContext, TaskHost taskHost, ItemBucket bucket, TaskExecutionMode howToExecuteTask, Boolean& taskResult)	C:\Users\*******\Documents\Projects\GettingStartedWithShaderEffectsinWPF\TestApplication\EffectsLibrary\EffectsLibrary.csproj	103	5	EffectsLibrary

My issue was caused by not having the DirectX SDK installed. The reference that I used indicated that the shader build task did not require the DirectX SDK; however, when I installed it, the error disappeared. So, I am not sure if this is the same error as initially reported, nor am I sure whether the DirectX SDK is required for shader build tasks. At this point, it is working for me.
